org.cougaar.core.component
Class ContainerSupport

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.GenericStateModelAdapter
      org.cougaar.core.component.ContainerSupport
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection, Component, Container, StateObject, GenericStateModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
Agent, AgentManager, DomainManager, MessageTransportServiceProvider, Node, PluginManager, ResolverContainer, RSSMetricsServiceProvider, ServerContainer
public abstract class ContainerSupport
extends GenericStateModelAdapter
implements Container, StateObject

The standard implementation of a Container.

Although this implementation defines many protected methods, it is long overdue for a major refactor, so developers should avoid complex subclassing to allow for future ContainerSupport cleanup. A simple ContainerSupport subclass, such as this example in core:
org.cougaar.core.wp.resolver.ResolverContainer
will only define the two required abstract methods and allow child components to advertise any necessary services.

Future refactor ideas include:

  • Obvious overall code cleanup into smaller classes and cleaner code.
  • Remove last remnants of component proprity (HIGH/BINDER/etc), since the core no longer uses it (bug 2522).
  • Replace "*.Binder" and ".BinderFactory" insertion point extension and "attachBinderFactory" with a new "BinderFactoryService" advertised by this container, and fix BinderFactories/Binders to use the new service.
  • Make a clearer distinction between binders that instantiate components v.s. binders that monitor service access. Create a new ComponentFactoryService for the former.
  • Extract state model actions (load/start/etc) to a binder or StateModelService, to make it easier for binders to intercept these calls and allow custom state model implementations (e.g. better threading, new states, etc).
  • With the above changes, limit Binders to ServiceBroker interactions and remove "ContainerProxy" and literal binder chaining -- to support service-focused binders, all we need to do is intercept ServiceBroker calls!
  • Plenty more to do..

binderFactories

protected final java.util.ArrayList binderFactories
a Sorted Collection of child BinderFactory components. Note that we cannot use TreeSet because of the Collection API's braindamaged insistance on conflating identity and order, so this is a regular arraylist which we keep sorted by hand.

binderFactoryDescriptions

protected final java.util.ArrayList binderFactoryDescriptions
The ComponentDescriptions for loaded binder factories.

specifyContainmentPoint

protected abstract java.lang.String specifyContainmentPoint()
override to specify insertion point of this component, the parent insertion point which sub Components must match, e.g. "Node.AgentManager.Agent.PluginManager" this is called once during initialization.

specifyChildServiceBroker

protected ServiceBroker specifyChildServiceBroker()
override to specify a the ServiceBroker object to use for children. this is called once during initialization. Note that this value might be only part of the process for actually finding the services for children and/or peers.

Either this method must be overridden to return a non-null value, or the subclass must call setChildServiceBroker exactly once with a non-null value.

createChildServiceBroker

protected ServiceBroker createChildServiceBroker(BindingSite bs)

destroyChildServiceBroker

protected void destroyChildServiceBroker(ServiceBroker csb)

setChildServiceBroker

protected final void setChildServiceBroker(ServiceBroker sb)

getChildServiceBroker

protected ServiceBroker getChildServiceBroker()
For subclass use, get the service broker shared by the child components, which the container subclass can use to directly add services.

Subclassing container is messy, and there are only a few examples in Cougaar where it is done, and even those should probably be refactored away.

Here we return a throw-away ViewedServiceBroker to intercept "addService" calls, otherwise the ViewService for the service clients will lack the provider "id" and component description.

getChildServiceBroker

protected ServiceBroker getChildServiceBroker(Binder b,
                                              java.lang.Object child)
Return (or construct) a serviceBroker instance for a particular child component.

The default is to ignore the child and return the value of getChildServiceBroker with no arguments.

This can be used to build per-child ServiceBroker instances as a simpler option than adding an additional high-priority wrapping binder. See also getChildContainerProxy.

addComponent

protected boolean addComponent(java.lang.Object c,
                               java.lang.Object cstate)
Add a component into our set. We are sure that this is the requested level, but might not be certain how much we trust it as of yet. In particular, we may need to treat different classes of Components differently.

The component (and the binder tree) will be transitioned to our container's current model state (e.g. ACTIVE).

Returns:
true on success.
Throws:
ComponentLoadFailure - when the component can not be loaded.

bindComponent

protected Binder bindComponent(java.lang.Object c)
Find a BinderFactory willing to bind this component, then wrap it with BinderFactoryWrappers.

loadBinderFactory

protected boolean loadBinderFactory(ComponentDescription cd)
Called when a componentDescription insertion point ends in .Binder or .BinderFactory

Throws:
ComponentFactoryException - if the BinderFactory Cannot be loaded.

checkBinderFactory

protected boolean checkBinderFactory(ComponentDescription cd)
Returns:
true iff the binderfactory is trusted enought to load

attachBinderFactory

protected boolean attachBinderFactory(BinderFactory c)
Activate a binder factory

getChildContainerProxy

protected ContainerAPI getChildContainerProxy(java.lang.Object o,
                                              ServiceBroker sb)
Specifies an object to use as the "parent" proxy object for a particular object (generally an unbound component). This will be either be the Container itself (this) or a simple proxy for the container so that BinderFactory instances cannot downcast the object to get additional privileges.

Set-state is called by the parent Container if the state is non-null.

The state Object is whatever this StateComponent provided in it's getState() implementation.

captureState

protected ComponentDescriptions captureState()

findInitialComponentDescriptions

protected abstract ComponentDescriptions findInitialComponentDescriptions()

getExternalComponentDescriptions

protected final ComponentDescriptions getExternalComponentDescriptions()
return a ComponentDescriptions object which contains a set of ComponentDescriptions defined externally to be loaded into this Container. This will return the value computed by findExternalComponentDescriptions() Note that this value is not filled until ContainerSupport.load() has been called.

Returns:
null if no component descriptions specified.
See Also:
findExternalComponentDescriptions()

findExternalComponentDescriptions

protected ComponentDescriptions findExternalComponentDescriptions()
Extending classes may override this method to define a set of externally-specified Component to load. Will be called during load() immediately after super.load(). load will set the value returned by getExternalComponentDescriptions(), so that loadInternalSubcomponents, etc can retrieve the values.

Returns:
null if none.

initialize

public void initialize()
Description copied from class: GenericStateModelAdapter
simple initialize method. Transits the state to UNLOADED.

Specified by:
initialize in interface GenericStateModel
Overrides:
initialize in class GenericStateModelAdapter

load

public void load()
Called by super.load() to transit the state, sets the value of getExternalComponentDescriptions() by calling findExternalComponentDescriptions(), then invokes each of
  • loadHighPriorityComponents()
  • loadInternalPriorityComponents()
  • loadBinderPriorityComponents()
  • loadComponentPriorityComponents()
  • loadLowPriorityComponents()
in order.

Specified by:
load in interface GenericStateModel
Overrides:
load in class GenericStateModelAdapter

start

public void start()
Description copied from class: GenericStateModelAdapter
This version of start just transits to ACTIVE. Daemon subclasses may want to start threads here.

Specified by:
start in interface GenericStateModel
Overrides:
start in class GenericStateModelAdapter

isSubComponentLoadable

protected boolean isSubComponentLoadable(java.lang.Object o)
Should check the ComponentDescription to see if it should be loaded into the Container. Implementations may use any rules they'd like. The default implementation returns true IFF the insertion point of the ComponentDescription is a direct child of the ContainmentPoint. The basic component model only calls this method during the default load() methods - e.g. only to load components specified by getExternalComponentDescriptions().

Parameters:
o - either a StateTuple or ComponentDescription
Returns:
true iff the specified ComponentDescription should be loaded.

isInsertionPointLoadable

protected boolean isInsertionPointLoadable(java.lang.String ip)
validate a child component's InsertionPoint. Simpler but less flexible mechanism to isSubComponentLoadable.

The default behavior is to return true IFF the insertion point is a direct child of the container's containement prefix.

loadHighPriorityComponents

protected void loadHighPriorityComponents()
Hook for loading all the high priority subcomponents. The default implementation loads all high priority components which match getSubComponentInsertionPoints().

loadInternalPriorityComponents

protected void loadInternalPriorityComponents()
Hook for loading all the internal priority subcomponents. The default implementation loads all internal priority components which match getSubComponentInsertionPoints().

loadBinderPriorityComponents

protected void loadBinderPriorityComponents()
Hook for loading all the binder priority subcomponents. The default implementation loads all binder priority components which match getSubComponentInsertionPoints().

loadComponentPriorityComponents

protected void loadComponentPriorityComponents()
Hook for loading all the component priority subcomponents. The default implementation loads all component priority components which match getSubComponentInsertionPoints().

loadLowPriorityComponents

protected void loadLowPriorityComponents()
Hook for loading all the low priority subcomponents. The default implementation loads all low priority components which match getSubComponentInsertionPoints().

loadSubComponentsByPriority

protected void loadSubComponentsByPriority(int priority)
Utility method used buy the Load*PriorityComponents methods. adds components as specified by getExternalComponentDescriptions of the specified priority.
